sect1.title: Gear Pump - Exploded View
sect1.para: Exploded view diagram of a gear pump.

sect1.title: Drive shaft
sect1.para: A drive shaft is a mechanical component for transmitting torque and rotation, usually used to connect other components of a drive train that cannot be connected directly because of distance or the need to allow for relative movement between them..

sect1.title: Bushings
sect1.para: A bushing, also known as a bush, is an independent plain bearing that is inserted into a housing to provide a bearing surface for rotary applications. The bushings in the gear pump provide a bearing surface for the drive gear and idler gear.

sect1.title: Gears
sect1.para: The gear pump uses two identical gears rotating against each other. One gear is driven by a motor and it in turn drives the other gear. Each gear is supported by a shaft with bushings on both sides of the gear.

sect2.title: Drive Gear (Rotor)
sect2.para: The drive gear in the gear pump is the gear that is driven by the motor.

sect2.title: Idler Gear
sect2.para: The idler gear is the gear that is driven by the drive gear .

sect2.title: Suction Port
sect2.para: The liquid enters in the pump through the suction port.

sect2.title: Pressure Port
sect2.para: The liquid leaves the pump through the pressure port (or discharge port).

sect2.title: Shaft Seal
sect2.para: This is a seal that is placed between the drive shaft and the main case of the gear pump.

sect2.title: Case Seal
sect2.para: The case seal is placed between the main case and the case cover.

sect1.title: Mounting Flange
sect1.para: Mounting Flange - The mounting flange is used to fix the pump on a support apparatus.
